titles.title: Securities and Exchange Commission Overpayment Credit Act
Securities and Exchange Commission Overpayment Credit Act
Securities and Exchange Commission Overpayment Credit Act
Securities and Exchange Commission Overpayment Credit Act
To amend the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to require the Securities Exchange Commission to refund or credit excess payments made to the Commission.
Securities and Exchange Commission Overpayment Credit Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by the Yeas and Nays: 59 - 0.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Financial Services. H. Rept. 115-275.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 195.

bill.summary:
Securities and Exchange Commission Overpayment Credit Act
(Sec. 2) This bill requires the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to offset future fees and assessments due from a national securities exchange or association that: (1) has previously overpaid such fees and assessments, and (2) informs the SEC of the overpayment within 10 years.
